features: Starting at just 1.2 pounds (not including Type Cover), with new 10.5” touchscreen.
Battery life up to 10 hours. Perfect for browsing, shopping, emails, and homework
Tablet portability, performance and laptop versatility with adjustable Kickstand and Signature Type Cover.
Stay connected with included USB-C port and headphone jack. Full HD front- and rear-facing cameras let you make crisp, clear calls to friends and family, or take and share great photos.
Hi-res touchscreen is perfect for browsing, playing, and binge watching.
Free Upgrade to Windows 11 when available (see below).
body.description: New 10.5” Surface Go 2 is perfect for keeping up and winding down — delivering tablet portability with laptop versatility, long battery life, a stunning touchscreen, and Windows security for the whole family. Browse, shop, and manage email with ease, relax with your favorite TV shows, and much more.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Connect and keep up Connect and keep up the way you want to with the 10.5” Surface Go 2. Starting at just 1.2 pounds (not including Type Cover*), with long battery life up to 10 hours , use it like a laptop or tablet. Learn, write, sketch, create Surface Go 2 can handle every to-do item throughout your day. Jot down ideas, help out with homework, create and practice presentations, and manage your email. A bigger screen, a better way to unwind Unwind in a bigger way with Surface Go 2, now featuring a new 10.5” PixelSense Display with touchscreen that’s perfect for eBooks, web browsing, and streaming your favorite shows. Seamless, safe, and secure Sharing Surface Go 2 with your family is seamless and secure, with parent-managed screen time limits, spending control, and content filtering — plus plenty of space for photos, videos, and music.

Laptop Work Smart - Connect Surface Go Signature Type Cover for a great typing experience when and where you need it. Tablet Just write - Take notes and complete homework directly on screen. Studio Express yourself - Adjust the built-in Kickstand to set your perfect angle for drawing, sketching and coloring with Surface Pen.

Complete your experience with Surface accessories Surface Go Signature Type Cover For a full keyboard experience anywhere, pair Surface Go Signature Type Cover with your Surface Go 2. Sleek and compact, it includes a complete, backlit keyset and large trackpad. Surface Pen Surface Pen is better and faster than ever, with tilt for shading, greater sensitivity, and virtually no lag to help you capture your thoughts and get more done. Surface Mobile Mouse Light and portable, with smooth scrolling and dongle-free Bluetooth connectivity, Surface Mobile Mouse is available in a new selection of rich colors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024

reviews.reviewText: It’s just as described you get the Microsoft features. Honestly perfect for college students it can be paired with the Inatek keyboard to make it easier.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very portable and handy
reviews.reviewText: I can put this in my purse and take to work with me. My laptop I could not. This is great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars $399 Entry Level Worth It!!
reviews.reviewText: So I primarily wanted this for my photography. Something I could show my photos on to my clients without having to take around a big laptop. This this the trick and more!!First the build quality is very nice. It has a metal cast matte feel to it. Feels very sturdy yet so light weight. The screen is nice and bright and is very clear. This just feels like quality.A lot of reviewers want you to stray from buying the entry level model because it's "super slow and sluggish and not worth the money" but that couldn't be further from the truth. The fact is, this little machine can multitask very well. I even had a long list of updates to the apps that are already installed and it updated each in minutes and updated maybe 3 or 4 at a time. Done super fast. The browser is smooth and works just fine. It does have a very minor stutter when you load the web page but nothing to get into a fit over. I even tried playing YouTube videos and they work just fine. I pushed it to do 4K and it played very smooth with no stutter or lag. Your internet connection will play a factor but if you've got that good connection then you should have no problem at all. I also have my phone connected to windows and it works great. I can keep focus on my work without having to look at my phone when I can just reply on the tablet itself with no issues.The only downside is, unless you really don't mind using it just as a tablet, I highly recommend getting a mouse and keyboard for it. At the very least a keyboard with track pad. Its very bad choice that Microsoft chose to leave these necessities out of the package. I highly recommend looking at less expensive alternatives to the Microsoft type cover and mouse. I have a $12 Bluetooth mouse and $30 keyboard that works just as well as the type cover. Both these devices have great connections and response times. These 2 devices are key for using this 2 in 1 to its potential. Specially if you're working from home or have some work to do.All in all, this is a great 2 in 1 for the price. At $399 I highly recommend this for anyone looking to do some simple work from home such as video calls, Office projects, or even watch movies and videos or just check social media and have something to take on the go. Works like a charm.Fun side story, when I first got this, I was setting up the tablet. My 1 year old was getting curious and playing with all the accessories that I got. I put the tablet down and was moving the stuff. She grabbed my phone and threw it towards the tablet. The corner of my phone smashed into the screen. Not even an hour of owning it and its getting stuff thrown into it. Tablet was fine, glass screen protector never cracked, and phone was ok. Talk about build quality. Lol

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Justo lo que necesitaba se adapta a todas mis neceaidades

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Have a 7 year old Surface pro which still works well but going to Europe for a month and a little nervous about taking the old one.........so took the plunge and got a new one.......so light and portable...Love the touch screen....keyboard is backlit!!! And the Amazon price was more than fair...... Very happy. NOTE: not happy with how Microsoft wants so take over my computer and run my life. What a struggle to put in my chrome but a friend helped win the fight. Just saying...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars "Our expectations for you were low but holy ----"
reviews.reviewText: SO. TLDR: It can't even run Paint comfortably.I bought this for myself exclusively to make art in Microsoft Paint during the slow periods at work. Given what I intended to use it for, I didn't think I needed good specs. It's Microsoft Paint, right? It's a robust little program in Windows 11 for what it is, but it's not like it's all that resource-intensive....So anyway, Paint lags on this thing with images that are even slightly middle-high resolution. And it's unstable. And I can very consistently crash it by resizing an image/selection via the resize menu more than once.And it's not like there's other stuff bogging the system down or anything. This is a fresh system. The only things I've installed are a bunch of official Windows updates + the Windows 11 upgrade (haven't even grabbed Chrome yet), and the only files I've added to its storage are images -- some doodles from Paint and some photos from the device's camera.I know this device is lightweight, but, like... *it's MS Paint.* It's not like I'm trying to run a game or stream a movie, I'm just trying to drag a 450x650 selection across an image. And it's lagging to the point that the program is stuttering or flat-out freezing for several seconds at a time. Like, "I'm using Paint, not PowerPoint" levels of stuttering. So definitely don't underestimate the reviews when people say it's "a little slow" -- the lack of processing power is hard to ignore.I would be returning this and seeking a refund if I didn't trash the packaging without thinking. It's not the desirable option I took it for, not in the slightest.UPDATE: Changing this to one star as I've realized the situation is much, much worse than I'd first realized.Scrolling or zooming -- whether by the scoll bar, trackpad, or on-screen buttons -- causes the device to rapidly input at two points on the image. I do not know why this is the case, and it seems to have varying effects depending on the tool equipped. This ranges from "Selection tool > selects part of the image/moves the selection" to "eraser - erases a streak and the erase can't be undone without undoing your previous 'real' input" to "Airbrush."I need to talk about the Airbrush.I do not know what is causing it right now, but I can't select the Airbrush tool on this current project because it will somehow create two separate orbs of paint, simultaneously, without me even touching the screen. I have absolutely no clue what would even be causing something like this and the fact that it's doing this is, frankly, appalling. It nearly wrecked my current project because I didn't realize it was happening at first.So, to reiterate: THIS IS NOT A DEVICE FOR ART. Please save your money and don't buy this for att unless you want to know what near-constant loss of productivity feels like.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good tablet alternative
reviews.reviewText: MS Surface Go's are reasonably priced and as full featured as a laptop. This one came with Window's 10 and upgraded during the update process to Window's 11. I thing the W11 runs a tad slower, I have an older Surface Go that cant be updated yet and it seems slightly faster, not a big deal however. I am not a big fan of android tablets since pretty much anything you do on them is tracked a dozen different ways. On the other hand, a Windows device I have some control of and can add VPN's, anti-tracking items and then configure the browsers more effectively. I recommend the Surface Go.
